books.title: The Rough Riders
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: The First United States Volunteer Cavalry fights in the Spanish–American War.

books.title: Ivanhoe
books.author: Walter Scott
books.summary: A disinherited knight returns from the Crusades and fights back against Prince John’s reign.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Green Forest Stories
books.author: Thornton W. Burgess
books.summary: A collection of four animal tales featuring the denizens of the Green Forest.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: Timon of Athens
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A wealthy Athenian lord becomes poor and friendless after his “friends” take advantage of his hospitality.

books.title: The House of Arden
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Two children, with the aid of a magical white mole, travel into the past in search of their family’s long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Wyvern Mystery
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: A young orphan marries a man with a secret that threatens to ruin both of them.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A famous detective investigates a mysterious and apparently supernatural threat to the heir of a wealthy Dartmoor estate.

books.title: How the Other Half Lives
books.author: Jacob Riis
books.summary: A social reformer documents the living conditions of the poor in the tenements of New York City.

books.title: The Theory of Moral Sentiments
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith assesses the sources of human morality and the role of human sympathies in judging the propriety of our actions and behaviors.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Sarah Louisa Forten Purvis
books.summary: A collection of poems by Sarah Louisa Forten Purvis.

books.title: Zuleika Dobson
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A beautiful magician unsuspectingly casts her charms on quiet Oxford.

books.title: The Night Land
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: A 17th-century gentleman is reincarnated on a far-future Earth where the sun has died, and scours the hellish landscape for his lost love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Robert E. Howard
books.summary: A collection of Robert E. Howard’s short stories, including the barbarian adventures of Conan the Cimmerian.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
